result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $299.00 to Courtney F. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Restitution to be paid first.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Credit for 126 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No contact with Courtney F.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
Provide a DNA sample.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

Concurrent with:  * Credit for 126 days.

Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has complied with victim rights.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 13 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 8 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.
These sentences are CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  
Conditions of Extended Supervision:-
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to Prioritized need areas so identified.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment
- No contact with: Courtney F
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $299.00 to Courtney F; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Restitution to be paid first.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Exhibit List, Filed

Appearances remain the same with the additon of Attorney Joe Riepenhoff.  Court addressed the witness Nazma G regarding her bench warrant.  Court withdraws the bench warrant.  Jury in box at 9:25 am.  Sworn and testified for the defense:  Nazma G.  Defense recalls Raynard R. who remains under oath. Jury out of box at 9:56 am.  Court made a record of sidebars.  Jury trial recessed for a break.  Case recalled.    Defendant advised of right to testify.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of his right to testify.  Defendant waives his right to testify.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Court reviews jury instructions on the record with parties.   Jury in box at 10:34 am.  Defense rests.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:39 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies  Vu Do and Gary Mason who were duly sworn for that purpose.  New deputy sworn at 1:04 pm, Deputy Bryan Lee.  Case recalled outside the presence of the jury.  Appearance remain the same except Attorney Riepenhoff does not appear.  Court made a record of jury's lunch break and of the two jury questions.   Jury in box.  At the hour of 1:13 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY on both counts which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Exhibit List, filed.  Jury Instruction, filed.  Jury questions, filed
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  As a matter of law, defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court REMANDED the defendant.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19 on 9/1/2015 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called.  Court held an individual voir dire with a juror.  Court made a record of sidebars.  Court informs parties that the defense witness is in custody.
Witness is an essential witness.  Court set cash bail at $10,000.00.
Body Attachment for witness Nazma K Govani

Case recalled.  Appearances remain the same except for Attorney Riepenhoff.  Defense witness has not appeared on her subpoena.  Court issues a bench warrant on defense witness Nazma G.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn and testified for the Defense:  Raynard R.  Jury recessed at 4:23 pm and instructed to return next day for continuation of the jury trial.  Court made a record of sidebars.  Jurors questions, filed.  Case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 19 on 8/21/15 at 8:30 am.

Case recalled.  Appearances remain the same.  Jury in box at 1:15 pm.   Testimony of MP officer Emanuelson resumes.  Exhibits 9, 9B and 9C, offered and received.  Sworn and testified for the State:  MP officer John Kohler.  Exhibit 10, offered and received.  State rests subject to rebuttal and subject to Exhibit 2.  Jury out of box at 2:16 pm.  Court made a record of sidebars.  Court made a record of jurors questions.  Exhibit 2, offered and received.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and argued.  Motion denied by the court.

Case recalled.  Appearances remain the same.  Jury in box at 11:11 am.  State recalls Courtney F. who remains under oath.  Sworn and testified to fhe State:  Jill McDonough, expert witness.  Exhibit 8, offered and received.  Jury out of box at 11:53 am for lunch.

Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in court with attorneys Lisa M. Procaccio and Joseph Riepenhoff.  Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called.  Defense raises a witness issue.  Court does not take action at this time.  Jury in box at 9:04 am.  Jury duly impanelled and sworn. Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Courtney F.  Exhibit 1 and 6, offered and received.  Sworn for the State:  MP officer Jeffrey Emanuelson.  Exhibit 3,4 and 5 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 10:13 am.  Court made a record of sidebars.  One of the side bars was defense motion for mistrial heard and argued.  Court denies the motion.

Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in court with attorneys Lisa M. Procaccio and Joseph Riepenhoff.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State recites its final offer on the record.  Defendant refuses the offer.  Case proceeded to jury trial.   Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Pretrial motions heard.  
Defendant advised of right to a jury on the first element of bail jumping.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of his right to a jury on the first element of bail jumping.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a jury on the first element of bail jumping.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:05 pm.  Court gave preliminary jury instructions.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause. Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box at 4:32 pm and instructed to return next day for continuation of jury trial.  Court placed sidebars on the record.  Defendant advised of right to a jury on the second element of bail jumping.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of his right to a jury on the second element of bail jumping.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a jury on the second element of bail jumping.
Preliminary jury instructions, filed
Jury trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:32 am.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell not in court, in custody. Tom Potter for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in court with attorney Calvin Malone for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in custody.  Ronald Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15CF221 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Jeffrey Emanuelson-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with COURTNEY F.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Defendant Deshawn Harold Jewell in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
